column1: Jieshi (simplified Chinese: 界石镇; traditional Chinese: 界石鎮; pinyin: Jièshí Zhèn) is a town in  32
column2: 300 under the administration of Wendeng District
column4: People's Republic of China. It is located 19 kilometres (12 mi) west-northwest of central Wendeng. Within Wendeng
column5: it borders the town of Gejia to the south. It also borders Huancui District to the north and Yantai City's Muping District to the west. The town oversees 65 administrative villages (行政村) and 88 natural villages (自然村).

column1: Jieshi sits in a basin surrounded on four sides by low-lying mountains
column2: among them the Kunyu Mountains (昆嵛山)
column3: the primary peak of which is Mount Taibo (泰礴顶).
